summary: I was always- and still kind of am, really- so bitter that there was never a way to transfer Pokemon from the Gen 2 games to Gen...
body: I was always- and still kind of am, really- so bitter that there was never a way to transfer Pokemon from the Gen 2 games to Gen 3 and up. I realize the technical wizardry involved at the time would’ve been extremely complicated, even for Nintendo, but the fact that my original Typhlosion is gone forever because it was stranded in a game with a faulty battery makes me sad.

reblog.comment: I was always- and still kind of am, really- so bitter that there was never a way to transfer Pokemon from the Gen 2 games to Gen 3 and up. I realize the technical wizardry involved at the time would’ve been extremely complicated, even for Nintendo, but the fact that my original Typhlosion is gone forever because it was stranded in a game with a faulty battery makes me sad.

trail.content_raw: I was always- and still kind of am, really- so bitter that there was never a way to transfer Pokemon from the Gen 2 games to Gen 3 and up. I realize the technical wizardry involved at the time would’ve been extremely complicated, even for Nintendo, but the fact that my original Typhlosion is gone forever because it was stranded in a game with a faulty battery makes me sad.
trail.content: I was always- and still kind of am, really- so bitter that there was never a way to transfer Pokemon from the Gen 2 games to Gen 3 and up. I realize the technical wizardry involved at the time would’ve been extremely complicated, even for Nintendo, but the fact that my original Typhlosion is gone forever because it was stranded in a game with a faulty battery makes me sad.

summary: The Mother 3 Ita team just recently uncovered a series of early, scrapped cutscenes contained within Map 0x0F, as well as the...
caption:
The Mother 3 Ita team just recently uncovered a series of early, scrapped cutscenes contained within Map 0x0F, as well as the full version of the game’s debug room.

These scenes are usually inaccessible by usual gameplay, but have been reconstructed as best as possible here by placing recordings to form the full scene.

You can read more about Mother 3′s unused content on The Cutting Room Floor.

summary: Sensor Tower: Dragalia Lost Has Now Reached $75,000,000 In Worldwide Revenue
title: Sensor Tower: Dragalia Lost Has Now Reached $75,000,000 In Worldwide Revenue
body:
Sensor Tower: Dragalia Lost Has Now Reached $75,000,000 In Worldwide Revenue

Sensor Tower has released some more data in regards to Dragalia Lost. According to Sensor Tower, “player spending in the Cygames-developed RPG has just surpassed $75 million worldwide on the App Store and Google Play, having reached the $50,000,000 milestone in early December”. This has already surpassed the $68,600,000 and estimated $70,800,000 life-to-date gross revenue that Super Mario Run…

View On WordPress

summary: NEW DETAILS SHARED ON THE UPCOMING FIRE EMBLEM FATES ART BOOK
title: NEW DETAILS SHARED ON THE UPCOMING FIRE EMBLEM FATES ART BOOK
body:
As we’ve previously covered, the Fire Emblem Fates art book is set to launch on April 25th, 2019 in Japan. Nintendo Dream has a new feature on the upcoming book, and it includes all sorts of fresh details. Check out a summary of the feature below.

- art book’s full title is “Fire Emblem Fates: Visual Guide – Pellucid Crystal”
- produced by the team behind the Tellius and Echoes books
- fully supervised by Intelligent Systems
- 320 pages
- includes various character artwork taken from in-game visuals and concept designs
- includes movie scenes, outlines of the storyline and all three paths, plus details regarding the world and story
- will not contain official artwork for every character
- Yusuke Kozaki is working on cover art, which will be revealed March 16th, 2019

summary: SUMMER POCKETS DATED FOR SWITCH RELEASE IN JAPAN
title: SUMMER POCKETS DATED FOR SWITCH RELEASE IN JAPAN
body:
The romance visual novel Summer Pockets has been given a Japanese release date for Switch. The title is due out June 20th, 2019, as confirmed by retailers Biccamera and Yodobashi. Check out synopsis of the game below.

Summer Pockets is set on an isolated, rural and peaceful island on the Seto Inland Sea called Torishirojima, which has a population of about 2,000 people. The protagonist is Hairi Takahara, a young man not native to the island. Hairi grew up in an urban setting, but after an unpleasant incident, he uses the recent death of his grandmother as an excuse to come to the island to take care of her estate sale. Once there, he gets to know four girls who are the focus of the story. They include Shiroha Naruse, who forgot her summer vacation; Ao Sorakado, who is pursuing the legends of the island; Kamome Kushima, a high-class girl looking for a pirate ship; and Tsumugi Wenders, a younger girl trying to find herself.

summary: FORTNITE'S WAILING WOODS SEEMS TO BE DYING
title: FORTNITE'S WAILING WOODS SEEMS TO BE DYING
body:
There have been a few tidbits pointing to a change for Wailing Woods in Fortnite, but most of those were from datamined info. We’re now getting evidence from the game itself.

Players in the game have noticed that the Wailing Woods seems to be dying, and it’s happening slowly week to week. The leaves on the trees appear to be browning, as does the ground around the woods. It almost looks like the entire area is decaying, which certainly isn’t good. Most likely by the start of Season 8, Wailing Woods as we know it will be gone.

summary: DRAGALIA LOST HITS $75 MILLION IN REVENUE, BEATS OUT LIFE-TO-DATE SUPER MARIO RUN AND ANIMAL CROSSING: POCKET CAMP REVENUE...
title: DRAGALIA LOST HITS $75 MILLION IN REVENUE, BEATS OUT LIFE-TO-DATE SUPER MARIO RUN AND ANIMAL CROSSING: POCKET CAMP REVENUE TOTALS
body:
Sensor Tower is back with another check-in on Dragalia Lost. The game continues to do quite well for Nintendo, as a new monetary milestone has been hit. Check out all the details below.

- grossed more than the life-to-date revenue of Super Mario Run and Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp
- surpassed $75 million worldwide on the App Store and Google Play
- the game hit the $50 million milestone in early December
- Japan has accounted for about 65 percent of Dragalia Lost’s $75 million grossed to date
- the United States is its second largest market at 18 percent of revenue
- the title ranked No. 29 for mobile game revenue in Japan last month, while it was No. 120 in the U.S.
- in January, it generated close to $15.7 million in player spending

- in January, it generated close to $15.7 million in player spending

summary: NASA HOLDS INTERNAL SMASH BROS. ULTIMATE TOURNAMENT
title: NASA HOLDS INTERNAL SMASH BROS. ULTIMATE TOURNAMENT
body: It can’t be work all the time, even if you’re holding a position at NASA. What does the NASA team do to kick back? Looks like they enjoy a bit of time with Smash Bros. Ultimate! The above image is an invite that NASA sent out to the Mars 2020 rover team, which was for a tournament that took place a few days back. Man, I hope some footage of this event turns up!
